channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Democrat Spanberger wins Virginia governor race with message on DOGE, cost of living
item.description: Spanberger, a former congresswoman, flips the governor's mansion from red to blue after campaigning against the Trump administration's federal layoffs and tariffs.
item.content:encoded:
Spanberger, a former congresswoman, flips the governor's mansion from red to blue after campaigning against the Trump administration's federal layoffs and tariffs.

(Image credit: Shaban Athuman)
item.dc:creator: Margaret Barthel

item.title: 'Teen Vogue' is moving under Vogue.com — and staffers are being laid off
item.description: Teen Vogue covered fashion and celebrity, but also took in-depth looks at politics and social justice issues. The union representing workers at Condé Nast said six staffers are losing their jobs.
item.content:encoded:
Teen Vogue covered fashion and celebrity, but also took in-depth looks at politics and social justice issues. The union representing workers at Condé Nast said six staffers are losing their jobs.

(Image credit: Phillip Faraone)
item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Blair

item.title: Worsening listeria outbreak tied to pasta products kills 6, hospitalizes 25
item.description: Certain prepared pasta dishes were recalled from retailers like Trader Joe's, Kroger and Walmart between June and October. Health officials urge customers to dispose of them and clean their fridges.
item.content:encoded:
Certain prepared pasta dishes were recalled from retailers like Trader Joe's, Kroger and Walmart between June and October. Health officials urge customers to dispose of them and clean their fridges.

(Image credit: Jennifer Oosthuizen)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: Public health defends its time-tested approach against the rise of MAHA
item.description: Public health leaders convene in Washington, D.C. this week to defend their vision for America's health, and look ahead for how to rebuild after the Trump administration's attacks on the system.
item.content:encoded:
Public health leaders convene in Washington, D.C. this week to defend their vision for America's health, and look ahead for how to rebuild after the Trump administration's attacks on the system.

(Image credit: EZ Event Photography/APHA)
item.dc:creator: Pien Huang

item.title: Why the DOJ's cases against Trump for election interference never came to a jury
item.description: Injustice authors Carol Leonnig and Aaron Davis say following Jan. 6, the cases against the former president were stymied by the FBI's desire to preserve its independence from politics.
item.content:encoded: Injustice authors Carol Leonnig and Aaron Davis say following Jan. 6, the cases against the former president were stymied by the FBI's desire to preserve its independence from politics.
item.dc:creator: Dave Davies

item.title: Former Vice President Dick Cheney dies. And, Election Day races to watch
item.description: Former Vice President Dick Cheney has died at age 84. And, today, voters in New York, Virginia and New Jersey choose new leaders in key races.
item.content:encoded:
Former Vice President Dick Cheney has died at age 84. And, today, voters in New York, Virginia and New Jersey choose new leaders in key races.

(Image credit: Alex Wong)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Meet the Austrian nuns who fled a care home to break into their old convent
item.description: Octogenarian Sisters Rita, Regina and Bernadette went back to their old convent with local support, and an Instagram following. "People are calling us the rebellious sisters!" Rita says.
item.content:encoded:
Octogenarian Sisters Rita, Regina and Bernadette went back to their old convent with local support, and an Instagram following. "People are calling us the rebellious sisters!" Rita says.

(Image credit: Joe Klamar)
item.dc:creator: Esme Nicholson

item.title: Dick Cheney, one of the most powerful vice presidents in American history, dies at 84
item.description: Cheney, who extolled the power of the presidency, died Monday, according to a statement from his family. The cause was complications of pneumonia and cardiac and vascular disease.
item.content:encoded:
Cheney, who extolled the power of the presidency, died Monday, according to a statement from his family. The cause was complications of pneumonia and cardiac and vascular disease.

(Image credit: Charles Dharapak)
item.dc:creator: Don Gonyea

item.title: President Trump facing a number of domestic challenges this week
item.description: After a week aboard, President Trump will confront a swirl of domestic challenges this week: pivotal elections in several states, Supreme Court tariff arguments and the ongoing government shutdown.
item.content:encoded: After a week aboard, President Trump will confront a swirl of domestic challenges this week: pivotal elections in several states, Supreme Court tariff arguments and the ongoing government shutdown.
item.dc:creator: Tamara Keith

item.title: A Planet Money Guide To Five Fascinating Economic Studies
item.description: The Planet Money newsletter rounds up some new economic studies.
item.content:encoded: The Planet Money newsletter rounds up some new economic studies.
item.dc:creator: Greg Rosalsky
